intro: Ursifolium pilczii, commonly known as the Pilczynski's urcell, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has a limited geographic range. Its botanical features include hairy stems and distinctive seed pods that split open upon maturity. Ursifolium pilczii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and conservation status.
